intro: Metastelma rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaved metaphytes, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. It features small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinct appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
